content.title: Devnarayan Pre-Matric Scholarship Scheme
content.department: Department of Social Justice and Empowerment
content.details: Extremely Backward Class Pre-Matric Scholarship Scheme has been implemented on the lines of the pre-matric scholarship scheme being given to Scheduled Caste and Scheduled Tribe students for classes 6th to 10th of very backward classes.
benefits: Selected students have to study according to the approved syllabus by State Government.
As per the rules Education, Accommodation, Meal, Dress, text writing material and books will be provided Free of cost.
Financial Assistance will be provided to the student on monthly basis.
eligibility: The students should be a native of Rajasthan state.

Applicant students should belong to the following Other Backward Classes, that must have been issued by Tehsildar or a higher-level revenue officer: Banjara, Baladiya, Labana; Gadia-Lohar, Gadolia; Gujar, Gurjar; Raika, Raibari (Debasi); Gadariya (Gadri), Gayari.
The annual income of the parents/guardian of the applicant from all sources (including the candidate's own income, if any) should be up to Rs.2,00,000 (Rupees two lakh).
An employed student who studies as a full-time student by taking leave without pay during the entire course will be eligible for the scholarship.
All the children of the same parent/guardian will be eligible to benefit from this scheme.
Students who are not getting any kind of scholarship or allowance for study from central, state / public sources.

faqs.question: What is this scheme?
faqs.answer: In Rajasthan, the Post-matriculation scholarship scheme is run by the Department of Social Justice and Empowerment for the educational upliftment of students.

faqs.question: Who Can Get The Benefits Of The Scheme?
faqs.answer: Very Backward Class Student Of Rajasthan State Who Full Fill The Eligibility Criteria.

faqs.question: What is the educational eligibility criteria?
faqs.answer: Students should be from class 6th to the 10th.

faqs.question: What is the benefit amount provided to boy students?
faqs.answer: From 6th to 8th class Boy Students: Rs. 50/- per month. From 9th To 10th Class Boy Students: Rs. 60/- Per Month.

faqs.question: What Is The Benefit Amount Provided To Girl Students?
faqs.answer: From 6th To 8th Class girl Students: Rs. 100/- Per Month. From 9th To 10th Class girl Students: Rs. 120/- Per Month.

faqs.question: What Is The Financial Eligibility Criteria?
faqs.answer: The Annual Income Of The Parents/Guardian Of The Applicant From All Sources (Including The Candidate's Own Income, If Any) Should Be Up To Rs.2,00,000 (Rupees Two Lakh).

faqs.question: How To Apply For The Scheme?
faqs.answer: Applicant students have to visit the official website, select the Login option or Register Option, log in with their Jan-Aadhaar ID, fill out the application form, attach the required documents, and submit.

faqs.question: What Documents Are Needed?
faqs.answer: Domicile Certificate Copy, Caste Certificate Copy, Income Certificate Copy, Education Qualification Marksheet / Certificate Copy, Jan Aadhar/Bhamashah Card Copy, Aadhar Card Copy.
